resources.string: This application requires the latest version of Google Play Services for AR.
This feature requires the latest version of Google Play Services for AR.
Installing Google Play Services for AR…
This image is too blurry to use.
"This image couldn't be connected to the rest of the scan. Try taking more photos between it and your other images."

"The selected images will be deleted from your project. This can't be undone.
Do you want to continue?"
Please clear some space in your device and try again. The total size of the images is %1$s.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Overlap each picture while keeping the object fully in frame, taking 50–70 images for small to medium objects.
Another set of 50–70 images should be enough.
Make sure to keep all your pictures in focus. Sharp pictures are essential for generating good 3D models.
First, circle your object while taking pictures.
Next, do two “upper arc” paths to capture the object from above.
Finally, get close to your subject and capture the details.
Adjust manually with sliders or tap the screen to select an area and lock focus or exposure with the lock icon.
Allows you to use a gray or white reference card to adjust color temperature. Confirm to set. For consistency, it’s best to keep the same color temperature throughout the entire scanning session.
You can turn the flash on or off while capturing images. For consistency, it’s best to keep the flash either on or off throughout the entire scanning session.
RealityScan needs at least %1$d pictures to generate a model. Only the projects that have enough pictures will be processed.
"RealityScan needs at least %1$d pictures to generate a model. If you leave now, your project won't be saved."
RealityScan needs at least %1$d pictures to generate a model.

We have determined that you have recently violated our Community Rules. As a consequence of the violation, and in order to maintain a safe and fun environment for everyone, we have decided to ban you from RealityScan. To learn more about your sanction you can go to My Sanctions page.
Your account does not yet meet the age requirements of RealityScan
No app found to open this link
%1$s is down for maintenance work. We will be back soon.
Your session has expired. Please sign-in again.
While cropping, look at your scan from different angles to adjust how the subject fits into the scan area.
In each view, touch and drag the corner and edge markers to resize the region. Everything outside the border will be removed from your model.
Tap the arrow at the bottom to show the tool drawer. Switch between a box and a cylinder, or rotate the subject by dragging the slider.
Avoid clear, shiny, or plain subjects like glass, metal, and featureless plastic.
Tap the record button once, then move around your subject to capture it from all angles.
As you capture, colored dots show your progress. When your subject is mostly green, tap the blue Next arrow to crop and process your scan.
After processing, you can save your model on your device, or share it with the Sketchfab community.
Touch and drag with one finger to orbit the view around the model.
"Zoom in: double-tap. Zoom out: pinch. Zoom to fit: press Reset View."
Touch and drag with two fingers to pan the view around.
While reviewing, you will see your subject as a point cloud.
Tap the arrow at the bottom to show the tool drawer. Tap the image icon to view the locations of your pictures in 3D, or the crop icon to define the area of your scan.
While cropping, look at your scan from different angles to adjust how the subject fits into the scan area.
In each view, touch and drag the corner and edge markers to resize the region. Everything outside the border will be ignored when reconstructing your model.
Tap the arrow at the bottom of the screen and drag the slider.
An error has occurred when fetching the license.
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
Tap to switch to Calendar view
Tap to switch to year view
This app does not have any open source licenses.
Internet browser is required for sign in
License details for open source software
This project is waiting for another project to finish downloading.
You can switch away from the app and come back anytime. Your project will continue downloading in the background.
Your model will be ready soon.
Your model will be ready for export soon.
We apologize for not being able to show older projects here! To view them, simply tap the \"%1$s\" button below.
%1$s You can still view on Sketchfab by tapping \"%2$s\".
"This project is from an older version."
Your model will be ready to be visualized soon.
Connect to a Wi-Fi or mobile data network to get back online.
You can switch away from the app and come back anytime. Your project will continue processing in the background.
Your scan will be ready soon.
This project is waiting for another project to finish uploading.
You can quit the app and come back anytime. Your project will continue processing in the background.
"You haven't sent this model for processing yet."
Your images are being uploaded to the cloud for processing.
You can switch away from the app and come back anytime. Your project will continue uploading in the background.
Processing multiple projects over a mobile network can use a very large amount of data.
"The selected projects will be deleted from your device. This can't be undone. Do you want to continue?"
"There's not enough disk space on this device for a new scan. Cleanup your data and try again."
Change your filter options in order to show your existing projects.
Get started by tapping the blue button below or checking out the %1$s.
You have more control over your camera settings (focus, auto exposure, etc). <font color=#ffffff>You will only be able to see the point cloud and camera positions after finishing the scan.</font>

Augmented Reality provides a real-time point cloud and camera positions, showing where you’ve taken pictures and if more are needed for a perfect scan. <font color=#ffffff>Advanced camera controls are not available in this mode.</font>
"%1$s got updated to version %2$s and brings some new features: %3$s"
No connection. Project status updates will resume when you are connected.
Uploading images for processing over a mobile network can use a significant amount of data.
You need an Internet connection to process your scan. Tap Process Later to save your project on your device and retry later when you have Internet access.
This will publish your model to Sketchfab.
This model may not be used in datasets for, in the development of, or as inputs to generative AI programs.
Tap the record button once to start capturing.
RealityScan needs access to your camera to continue. You can allow access in your device’s Settings.
RealityScan needs access to your camera to continue.
"Returning to the Projects page finishes the capture stage for your project. You won't be able to add any more photos to this project later."

"RealityScan uses large amounts of data. You’re currently not on Wi-Fi, so this data will go through your mobile network.
To prevent data usage, turn on Offline Mode in the Settings."
Unable to handle the task due to insufficient memory.
RealityScan is not supported on your device

Beginning January 3, RealityScan will only be usable by users who are 18 years of age or older. In order to continue using RealityScan, you will be asked to accept an updated End User License Agreement.
Nothing to Crop!" Make sure at least part of the model is inside the crop box."
Angle between device and cameras is too big.
"Yellow images are blurry. Replace them with new images."
Device is too far from other cameras.
Slow Down!" You're moving too fast for accurate tracking. Try moving more slowly."
"You're too far away from the other images. Try moving closer."
Capture the object by taking photos in loops around it. Cover all angles, and keep images close together.
Capture your subject automatically by looking at it from all angles.
"Can't find your object!"" Your lighting may be too bright or too dark."
%1$d images left before you hit the limit.
Unconnected Images!" Red images are disconnected from the rest. Take more photos between the red and green ones to connect them."

Keep capturing!
RealityScan needs at least %1$d pictures to generate a model.
"Can't find your object!"" Trying to recover your location in 3D space. Move back to where you started your scan."
"Your project's not ready for review yet. Capture more images and give them time to process."
"You're currently offline. Connect to a WiFi or mobile network to review the point cloud."
You need at least %1$d images to generate a point cloud or model. Start a new project and take more photos.
"Touch and drag to rotate. Pinch to zoom."
You need an Internet connection to process your scan. Tap Process Later to save your project on your device and retry later when you have Internet access.
RealityScan is configured to only process data through a Wi-Fi network. To change this, select Wi-Fi + Mobile Data under Data Usage in Settings.
Fill the preview area with a gray or white surface to set the color temperature.
Keeps the mesh at the highest detail, ideal for capturing tiny details on objects (faces, coins etc).
Makes the mesh less noisy. Good for surfaces that don’t require lots of intricate details.
The best possible mesh resolution, good for highly detailed objects - up to 1 million polygons.
Good for most cases. Generates a mesh of around 100k polygons.
Good for most cases, while not compromising texture file size. Texture sharpness depends on how well your pictures are in focus.
Great for closeups and detailed shots. Texture sharpness depends on how well your pictures are in focus.
Images are still being analyzed. You can set the reconstruction region once the analysis is complete.
Connection problems: Downloading results is slow.
Connection problems: Packet loss is occurring.
Connection problems: Round-trip time is high.
Connection problems: Uploading photos is slow.
You have more than %1$d%% of unconnected images in your scan. Parts of your model might be missing in the final result. It is recommended to fix those before proceeding.
When Auto Capture is on, RealityScan takes photos automatically as you move around the subject. You can also press the volume buttons to take a picture at any time.
Help improve RealityScan by allowing Epic Games to store and reuse your photos and data anonymously for machine learning
RealityScan may use large amounts of mobile data when you’re not connected to Wi-Fi.
Transfers data only when connected to a Wi-Fi network. When not connected to Wi-Fi, AR and export features are disabled.
Use HEIF format to store captured photos. Saves mobile data usage and disk space.

Begin every scan in AR Guidance mode. This mode uses Augmented Reality to provide a real-time view of a quality point cloud and camera positions, helping you accurately capture your subject as you scan. No camera controls available in this mode.
Always confirm which mode to use at the start of a scan.

Start each scan in Camera Control mode. Allows full control over your camera settings while scanning. Once you’ve scanned your subject and the images have been analyzed, you’ll be able to view the point cloud and camera positions.
Are you sure you want to sign out from your account?
In the next step, you will need to create a new Sketchfab account, which is necessary for sharing your model.
You can use the volume buttons on your phone to manually take pictures while in auto or manual capture mode.
Use the volume buttons to capture
In Augmented Reality Mode, when you see red images while scanning, it means they did not connect properly. Take more pictures between green and red ones to connect them.
Moving too fast when taking pictures might cause your photos to be blurry, which will either result in red images (unconnected) or poor quality meshes.
Don’t move too fast while capturing
Just tap the pictures icon on the bottom right and select which images to delete.
You can delete pictures while scanning
You can submit your feedback by going to the Settings and tapping “Submit Feedback”.
You can check the RealityScan Documentation in Epic Developer Community. Tap this tip to go there now.
Remember to turn off mobile data usage in the Settings if you have limited bandwidth. Tap this tip to go to this setting now.
Overcast days are the best ones for scanning outdoors, since the shadows are soft and light is evenly distributed. Give it a shot and see your outdoors scans improve significantly!
Cloudy days are the best for scanning!
This version of RealityScan is outdated. Please tap the update button below to install the latest version.
